title: Federal Reserve Adjusts Settings on Rate-Control Tool Kit
sub_head: Technical move is expected to keep key fund rates within target
body:
The Federal Reserve on Wednesday raised the level of two key rates it uses to control the setting of the federal-funds rate, its chief lever for influencing the economy to reach its job and inflation goals.
The Fed said that it had boosted the rate it pays banks to park cash at the central bank, known as the interest on excess reserves rate, or IOER, from 0.10% to 0.15%, and increased the reverse repo rate, or RRP, from 0% to 0.05%.
